posts.title: Colombian Migrant Dies Under ICE Custody In Missouri While Waiting For Deportation
top_comments:
> ICE spokeswoman Alethea Smock told press that there is no additional information regarding the death. "Consistent with ICE protocols, the appropriate components were notified about the death, including the Department of Homeland Security Office of Inspector General and the ICE Office of Professional Responsibility," the agency added in a statement. "Additionally, ICE notified the next of kin."


So they just found the poor man dead and have no clue how he died? ICE is seriously out of control.
And of course, ICE bears no responsibility whatsoever. <insert eye roll>
I wonder how many have already perished without us knowing about it, and that's even before we count the people sent to CECOT. It's reprehensible.
That's murder. At best, negligent homicide.
Absolutely disgraceful

It's finally happened, a death is being reported. Unfortunately, the people that support the mass deportation will only look at this part of the article:

>Rayo-Garzon had previously been arrested for shoplifting and was again detained in March for credit card fraud, St. Louis police said.  
...  
There is no evidence that the death of Rayo-Garzon, however, was a result of mistreatment from authorities.

This guy was in custody since June 2024, but the headlines are going to cause even more panic and possibly escalate the resentment and response people have for ICE. People have died in ICE custody before, and this current administration offers no incentive to improve or even maintain the handling of human beings to any standards.
It's appalling how many hateful government cunts allow this shit to happen.
The best part is they will find themselves innocent when they do an internal investigation.

Makes you wonder why the ENTIRE office of [CRCL](https://www.pogo.org/investigations/dhs-removed-100-civil-rights-and-civil-liberties-records) got fired by DOGE. Never mind, they would've been the ones to investigate this.
And there will be no investigation or consequences. This is disgusting.

posts.title: Judge rules federal government owes nearly $28 million to North Dakota for pipeline protests

Can't sue the government unless the government lets you.

posts.title: Tornado victims blocked from federal recovery aid after Trump denied request
top_comments:
This nugget shocked me..

Trump easily carried the state or Arkansas for the third time in a row in 2024, this time by a 30.64% margin, the largest since 1972.

From article-

Disaster survivors in Arkansas left homeless by recent tornadoes have been blocked from receiving federal recovery aid after President Donald Trump rejected the state’s request to declare a major disaster in March.

The Trump administration denied Republican Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders’ request for individual and public assistance following an outbreak of severe storms and tornadoes that also affected neighboring Mississippi and Missouri and left more than 40 people dead.
Gonna start selling MAGA bootstraps on every religious radio station in that state.
All the Leopards eating faces would be pretty entertaining if it wasn't for the fact that good people who didn't vote for this are also suffering.
YUP. There is only one way for all this to go, going forward. NOT looking forward to the wildfires and hurricane season later in the year.

God, remember when conservatives were whining about Biden not “funding FEMA” while voting for the republican Congress members who campaigned on defunding FEMA? 

I’m sick of maga cult members not understanding their own fucking politics.
Where is the outcry from the ignorant conservatives who were super pissed when they believed the lie that Biden was cutting fema to red states?

Red state asks for help because they can’t afford a few billion to cover a disaster.  So, like a \*\*communist\*\* state, they ask the rest of us to pay for their misfortune.    


Maybe their god can share some of those prosperity dollars they have collected to help out. 

/s.  I don’t want to see people suffer.  I really don’t. But it is incredibly hard not to turn a blind eye to the plight of people who continue to dig their own graves while screaming to bring the rest of us down as well.
Thanks for voting for me Arkansas... but tornadoes are your problem.
Another red state discovers leopards.
Is this going to get the same play on MSM that trump's attacks on Biden/Harris in '24 about North Carolina got?

posts.title: Maryland judge orders return of Venezuelan asylum seeker deported to El Salvador | CNN Politics
top_comments: Yes. Due process for every last person that we've sent. Every single human that we've deported there is protected under the constitution and the day we stop defending that is the day that we all surrender our own constitutional rights.
Add it to the list of shit they'll ignore because who's gonna do anything about it?
Donald Trump thinks that asylum means "insane asylum" and that's why he says it all the time. I really do believe this.
But have we looked at his tattoos. According to our gov, tattoos are the fundamental principle of fairness.

Order schmorder, you have no power over the king.

I HATE this timeline.

Well, didn't the supreme court also order the return of the one wrongfully sent to El Salvador a while ago. Does anyone really believe that will happen?

The constitution crisis is here now. When an order of the supreme court is ignored, the house of cards is going to come crashing down because the only thing holding up our constitution is the belief that it should be. There is no real power being allocated to the judicial.

> The Trump administration, according to the order, has argued Cristian’s deportation did not violate the settlement, asserting “his designation as an alien enemy pursuant to the AEA results in him ceasing to be a member” of the class action. The government invoked the Alien Enemies Act, an 18th-century wartime authority, on March 15 to deport alleged members of Tren de Aragua, a Venezuelan gang Trump accuses of “perpetrating an invasion of and predatory incursion into the United States.”
A sworn declaration from Robert Cerna, the ICE acting Field Office Director for Enforcement and Removal Operations, said Cristian had been arrested in Texas in January.
“On January 6, 2025, (‘Cristian’) was convicted in the 482nd District Court at Harris County, Texas, for the offense of possession of cocaine,” Cerna stated in the filing. Cerna added that Immigration and Customs Enforcement determined Cristian was subject to removal following the invocation of the AEA.

So he was deported to El Salvador when he was from Venezuela. Against orders of a legal settlement that gave him protection. To be placed in CECOT, but the only detailed claim against him is he had cocaine. Are we going to be arresting every college kid who does cocaine and tossing them in a US Supermax without due process? Due process must be upheld for all, or it is too easy for our government to incarcerate anyone on a whim.

posts.title: Dozen states sue Trump in bid to block new tariffs
top_comments: In addition to New York, the plaintiffs in the new lawsuit filed Wednesday include Arizona, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Illinois, Maine, Minnesota, New Mexico, Oregon, and Vermont
Good, because this shit is weeks away from causing about half my industry to disappear.
Take me back to 2024 before this administration

There was clip of powerful bankers in his office and he  was saying he made 900 million yesterday, and this other guy made 2.5 billion. He’s causing dips on purpose so him and rich friends can buy low and then sell later. He announced some tariffs a while back then walked them back 90 days later. This is market manipulation.
I work for a solar company who everyone here (aside from me) are Trump voters. Yet they’re all still licking his boot.
Couldn't they just get their congress members to, do their job instead?
Thank you to every single state doing this, sadly I'm not in one.
Taxation without representation!  Throw it all into the harbor, boys!
It’s one of the single dumbest things I’ve ever seen an individual do. And he happens to be the most powerful individual in the world. Pretty amazing, in a weird way

If you live in a red state (like me) and are thinking of moving somewhere away from the madness (at least a little bit) then you now have a list of states that will at least try to stand up for their citizens in the face of this insanity. 

"In addition to New York, the plaintiffs in the new lawsuit filed Wednesday include Arizona, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Illinois, Maine, Minnesota, New Mexico, Oregon, and Vermont."

Not saying there's not crazy to be had everywhere, but I'm going to assume most of these states are not trying to make it illegal to speak badly about Trump, make Trump's birthday a holiday, rename major airport after him, and ask his administration with help in ensuring they'll be able to keep the billions in federal tax subsidies for public education after they pass an unconstitutional bill to ban undocumented kids from public schools. All of this and more is happening in Tennessee- and the news says the tariffs will hurt TN too- but our spineless and horrid super majority GOP state government is too busy doing racist, bigoted victory laps to care.

posts.title: After a month of searching, man learns from NBC News that DHS sent his brother to El Salvador
top_comments: How many people have been disappeared that we don't  even know about?

That must’ve been a horrifying revelation. Like on the one hand you’d be glad that you know where they are, but on the other hand holy fuck they’re at a forced labor camp in a different country.

Edit Apologies, he may be at a concentration camp or death camp instead. I was going off the fact that the president of El Salvador said that he was going to be using these prisoners for labor.

>Asked for details and documents supporting DHS’ allegations of criminality, McLaughlin responded: “We aren’t going to share intelligence reports and undermine national security every time a gang member denies he is one. That would be insane.” 


Translation here is "We don't have any, besides that he's Venezuelan. We also didn't bother with due process."
So the secret police took him away and couldn't be bothered to notify anybody? They're likely in a concentration camp...

>Adrián, 27, came to the United States in 2023 by appointment through the CBP One app. Alejandro provided NBC News a photo of a printout confirming his brother’s June 12, 2023, appointment.  

>Adrián had also applied for temporary protected status, according to a Dec. 1, 2024, document from U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, a part of DHS that handles immigration benefits. 

So this guy did EXACTLY what the government asked him to do to come in legally, and they still said he was here illegally.

> Asked for details and documents supporting DHS’ allegations of criminality, McLaughlin responded: “We aren’t going to share intelligence reports and undermine national security every time a gang member denies he is one. That would be insane.”

Literally the administration is arguing that they shouldn’t have to prove anything in court or anywhere else.  They scoop people off the street, deport them to a foreign gulag, and when asked why, respond “trust me bro. . . “

How conservatives can defend this shit is beyond me.

"The law holds that it is better that ten guilty persons escape than that one innocent suffer."

\-- William Blackstone, 1760s

"We're getting them out... and you can't have a trial for all of these people."

\-- Donald Trump, 04/22/2025
This is so goddamn repulsive. It’s ghoulish.

That’s the thing… they’re all crying “We’re not members of Tren de Agua!” But the problem is we’ll never know. They never got to respond to the government’s very serious allegations against them and are now indefinitely detained in a country they are not from. This is actually really fucked.
Think of every despotic, authoritarian government that disappears people off its streets and denies it all, and realize that this is what the United States of America is under the Republicans.

posts.title: German beer sales down at home and abroad
top_comments:
>Non-alcoholic beer has, however, been seeing a huge increase in sales in Germany as those of alcoholic beverages fall.

People are just switching to non alcoholic drinks.

Beer quality abroad has surged. 

I used to buy German beers because the purity laws gave me some confidence I wasn't just drinking a pint of preservatives sure to give me a mega hangover, but there's so many good local micro to medium sized brewers now, it makes more sense to support local businesses.
According to my bank account, yep. I used to buy about $200 in Weihensptephaner, Hofbrau, Spaten and Fruh every month. Now it's down to less than $100.

Deleted because replied wrong, was meant for a commentator, not OP

Edit: thank you, kind redditor, for the award.
I wonder if it's more competition from Japanese beers? Like I've noticed the past few years that Asahi beers are now being served alot more then they used to and offerings in supermarkets.
Personally I enjoy a good German pilsner or dunkel.  Craft breweries in the US only want to make IPAs.  I don't like IPAs, they hide any taste they might have behind way too much hops.

If I want to get drunk, I drink cheap beer. German beer has always been overrated.

Either way, in my case, most of the time, if I want to get drunk and I'm with friends and family, I just drink good wine. I'm from Portugal, and Portugal has some high-quality wine at low prices. But I'm not picky, I’ll drink any good wine from any southern European country.
Less domestic alcohol consumption is a win in my book.
Dab drinking Canadian here doing my part.  It’s the best beer for the low price here.
German beer is to bitter...

I wonder how many have already perished without us knowing about it, and that's even before we count the people sent to CECOT. It's reprehensible.

>Rayo-Garzon had previously been arrested for shoplifting and was again detained in March for credit card fraud, St. Louis police said.  
...  
There is no evidence that the death of Rayo-Garzon, however, was a result of mistreatment from authorities.

This guy was in custody since June 2024, but the headlines are going to cause even more panic and possibly escalate the resentment and response people have for ICE. People have died in ICE custody before, and this current administration offers no incentive to improve or even maintain the handling of human beings to any standards.
It's appalling how many hateful government cunts allow this shit to happen.

> The Trump administration, according to the order, has argued Cristian’s deportation did not violate the settlement, asserting “his designation as an alien enemy pursuant to the AEA results in him ceasing to be a member” of the class action. The government invoked the Alien Enemies Act, an 18th-century wartime authority, on March 15 to deport alleged members of Tren de Aragua, a Venezuelan gang Trump accuses of “perpetrating an invasion of and predatory incursion into the United States.”
A sworn declaration from Robert Cerna, the ICE acting Field Office Director for Enforcement and Removal Operations, said Cristian had been arrested in Texas in January.
“On January 6, 2025, (‘Cristian’) was convicted in the 482nd District Court at Harris County, Texas, for the offense of possession of cocaine,” Cerna stated in the filing. Cerna added that Immigration and Customs Enforcement determined Cristian was subject to removal following the invocation of the AEA.

So he was deported to El Salvador when he was from Venezuela. Against orders of a legal settlement that gave him protection. To be placed in CECOT, but the only detailed claim against him is he had cocaine. Are we going to be arresting every college kid who does cocaine and tossing them in a US Supermax without due process? Due process must be upheld for all, or it is too easy for our government to incarcerate anyone on a whim.
